Sentencas: Carbon deposition is a critical problem for operating solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with carbon containing fuels such as natural gas, biogas, etc.
Titulo: 3D microstructures of solid oxide fuel cell Ni-YSZ anodes with carbon deposition

Sentencas: When steam to carbon ratio is below the critical threshold, carbon may form on the surface of nickel (Ni) catalyst.

Sentencas: Carbon covers the active triple boundaries and deteriorates the electro-chemical performance.
Titulo: 3D microstructures of solid oxide fuel cell Ni-YSZ anodes with carbon deposition

Sentencas: In most severe cases, carbon may even lead to an irreversible deformation of a porous cermet.
Titulo: 3D microstructures of solid oxide fuel cell Ni-YSZ anodes with carbon deposition

Sentencas: However, quantitative investigations of carbon deposition have been limited due to the difficulties in observing the microstructures.
Titulo: 3D microstructures of solid oxide fuel cell Ni-YSZ anodes with carbon deposition

Sentencas: In the present study, the 3D structures of carbon deposition in the SOFC electrode are quantitatively reconstructed for the first time by a machine learning assisted image processing framework.

Sentencas: Focused ion beam -scanning electron microscope (FIB-SEM) measurements of anode samples are conducted without resin infiltration.

Sentencas: A U-net neural network with multiple inputs is developed to identify the unfilled pores, from which phase segmentations of raw SEM images without resin filling became possible.

Sentencas: The mild and severe carbon deposition conditions are tested by exposing the electrodes to humidified and dry methane conditions.

Sentencas: It is revealed from the 3D reconstruction that carbon layer formed over Ni particles and Ni pulverizes due to high temperature corrosion (metal dusting).

Sentencas: The observed microstructural changes are in good agreement with the performance recovery after the regeneration process.
